## FAQ {#faq}

**Q: Do I need to download the textbook?**  
A: No, it's optional. You can access course readings through the library or online sources.

**Q: Can I use Excel instead of R?**  
A: Yes, Excel works for basic analysis. R is recommended for more complex projects.

**Q: What if I already use a note-taking app?**  
A: Obsidian is recommended but optional. The course works with Notion, OneNote, or even physical notebooks.

**Q: Where do I turn in my work?**  
A: Save deliverables in your Liaison_Vault under `03_Project/`. Dr. Leith will collect via email or learning management system.

**Q: Can I work with others?**  
A: Absolutely! Pair programming and collaborative analysis are encouraged. Document who contributed what.

**Q: What if I fall behind?**  
A: Reach out to Dr. Leith early. The phases are structured but flexibleâ€”we can adjust timelines if needed.

**Q: Are there textbooks or readings?**  
A: Course readings will be posted in each phase. Check Phase 1 for the syllabus.

## Recommended Third-Party Resources

### For Data Analysis
- [R4DS Online Learning Community](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) - Free R guide
- [Python Data Science Handbook](https://jakevdp.github.io/PythonDataScienceHandbook/) - Free Python guide
- [Kaggle Learn](https://kaggle.com/learn) - Short courses on data skills

### For Research Methods
- [JSTOR Daily](https://daily.jstor.org/) - Accessible research articles
- [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/) - Academic search
- [ResearchGate](https://www.researchgate.net/) - Connect with researchers

### For Communication
- [Data Viz Catalogue](https://www.datavizcatalogue.com/) - Chart types and usage
- [Canva](https://www.canva.com/) - Free design templates
- [Hemingway App](http://www.hemingwayapp.com/) - Improve your writing clarity

## Software Comparison Chart

| Tool | Cost | Best For | Learning Curve |
|---|---|---|---|
| **Obsidian** | Free | Note-taking, vault organization | Easy |
| **Git/GitHub** | Free | Version control, collaboration | Medium |
| **R/RStudio** | Free | Statistical analysis, detailed control | Medium-Hard |
| **Python** | Free | Data wrangling, flexible analysis | Medium |
| **VS Code** | Free | Code editing, multiple languages | Medium |
| **Excel** | Paid | Quick analysis, pivot tables | Easy |
